dt: {bc}to place under {a_link|restrictions} as to use or distribution

pt: {sc}limit{/sc} {sc}restrict{/sc} {sc}circumscribe{/sc} {sc}confine{/sc} mean to set bounds for. {sc}limit{/sc} implies setting a point or line (as in time, space, speed, or degree) beyond which something cannot or is not permitted to go.
{sc}restrict{/sc} suggests a narrowing or tightening or restraining within or as if within an encircling boundary.

pt.t: laws intended to {it}restrict{/it} the freedom of the press

pt: {sc}circumscribe{/sc} stresses a restriction on all sides and by clearly defined boundaries.

pt.t: the work of the investigating committee was carefully {it}circumscribed{/it}

pt: {sc}confine{/sc} suggests severe restraint and a resulting cramping, fettering, or hampering.

shortdef: to place under restrictions as to use or distribution
